intro: Nepeta amethystina subsp. mallophora, commonly known as the purple catmint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of lavender-blue flowers. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators. Its foliage and flowers are often used in gardens for their visual and ecological benefits.
